entities.name: BICYCLE
entities.description: A two-wheeled vehicle propelled by human power, with a rich history of evolution and innovation spanning centuries

entities.name: BARON KARL VON DRAIS
entities.description: A German inventor who created the earliest known prototype of the bicycle, the draisine, in the early 19th century

entities.name: DRAISINE
entities.description: The earliest known prototype of the bicycle, a two-wheeled vehicle without pedals, propelled by the rider pushing off the ground with their feet

entities.name: VELOCIPED
entities.description: An early bicycle featuring pedals attached directly to the front wheel, offering a smoother ride and greater speed than the draisine

entities.name: PENNY-FARTHING
entities.description: A high-wheel bicycle with a large front wheel and a smaller rear wheel, popular among wealthy gentlemen for its speed and elegance but also dangerous due to its design

entities.name: SAFETY BICYCLE
entities.description: A bicycle with two wheels of equal size, a chain drive system, and pneumatic tires, making it more stable, comfortable, and efficient than its predecessors

entities.name: STEEL
entities.description: The primary material used in bicycle frames in the early 1900s, offering strength and durability at a reasonable cost

entities.name: ALUMINUM
entities.description: A material that emerged as a popular alternative to steel in the mid-20th century, providing lighter weight and increased stiffness for improved performance

entities.name: TITANIUM
entities.description: A material that emerged as a popular alternative to steel in the mid-20th century, providing lighter weight and increased stiffness for improved performance

entities.name: CARBON FIBER
entities.description: A revolutionary material introduced in the late 20th century, used in bicycle construction for its lightweight, strong, and aerodynamic properties

entities.name: ELECTRIC BIKES
entities.description: Bicycles with motorized assistance, offering easier riding and longer distances, introduced in recent years

entities.name: TOUR DE FRANCE
entities.description:
A major professional cycling race that showcases the speed, skill, and endurance of elite cyclists
A professional cycling race that showcases the speed, skill, and endurance of elite cyclists

entities.name: FRANCE
entities.description: Country where the Tour de France, a major professional cycling race, takes place

relations: The Tour de France is a professional cycling race that highlights the evolution and performance of bicycles
The bicycle's early development, including the draisine, took place in Germany
France has been a significant location for the evolution of the bicycle, including hosting the Tour de France
The safety bicycle was a significant milestone in the evolution of the bicycle, making it more stable and accessible
Carbon fiber has been a revolutionary material in the construction of modern bicycles, enhancing their performance
Electric bikes are a modern evolution of the bicycle, offering motorized assistance for easier riding and longer distances
Baron Karl von Drais invented the draisine, the earliest known prototype of the bicycle
Baron Karl von Drais was a German inventor who created the draisine
The draisine was a predecessor to the velocipede, which introduced pedals for propulsion
The velocipede was a predecessor to the penny-farthing, which featured a large front wheel and a smaller rear wheel
The penny-farthing was succeeded by the safety bicycle, which was more stable and comfortable
The safety bicycle was primarily made of steel, which provided strength and durability
Steel was succeeded by aluminum as a popular material for bicycle frames, offering lighter weight and increased stiffness
Steel was succeeded by titanium as a popular material for bicycle frames, offering lighter weight and increased stiffness
Aluminum was succeeded by carbon fiber, which provided even lighter weight and improved aerodynamics
Titanium was succeeded by carbon fiber, which provided even lighter weight and improved aerodynamics
Carbon fiber frames have been used in the development of advanced electric bikes, enhancing their performance
The Tour de France is a major professional cycling race that takes place in France
